Discuss. Or not. I don't care. [COLOR='#171717']I do care @____@

item.title: Killing Floor 2!
item.dc:creator: Diabolical
item.description:
Keep this in mind.

It is quite likely that there are some regions where we may be required to make cuts in the future, particularly in the gore system, to comply with local ratings boards, once we get the game into its full release status. Regions most likely at risk of this are Germany (via USK) and Australia (via OFLC). Japan is another possibility (via CERO), but is an unknown quantity to us. To be quite clear: this means that, if you are buying from a region which regularly forces cuts on to games for gore, you may get reduced gore when we go to the full release version of the game.

https://www.kotaku.com.au/2015/04/killing-floor-2-dev-highlights-australia-as-problem-region-for-classification/

Read full topic

item.title: Killing Floor 2!
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
So early access released today and it’s fucking awesome.

EDIT: Also, I wasn’t a terribly big fan of the first one (though I typically played that on solo play) but I’ve been playing this online and with the far more streamlined perk ranks, the weapon handling, the gore system, etc. this game is straight up excellent.

Also I listen to most of the bands that they have as background music (that you can turn off if you’re not big into metal) so that’s the icing on the cake.

Read full topic

item.title: Killing Floor 2!
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Keresh:

GUNS GUNS GUNS

Gibson gets even more excited about KF2’s new gun technology when he talks about weapon accuracy and recoil. Most games, he explains, represent accuracy with a bullet spread…“We wanted to actually have the gun physically move instead of having some magic number that you tweak that makes the bullets go in random directions. The gun’s accurate; if you can manage to keep your sights on an enemy, you will hit it. The crosshair’s just moving around, but wherever that crosshair is, that’s where the bullet’s actually going.”

Is it just me or is that really really really really cool? I thought about this a while ago with CS:GO, it’s really annoying and noticeable when your bullets leave the barrel at a 30+ degree angle.

I get the feeling the only reason Valve hasn’t fixed the problem is because the CS community is so rabidly anti change that they can’t accept even a positive, and simply aesthetic, modification to the game’s core features.

Read full topic

item.title: Killing Floor 2!
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
The way they handle blood by dynamically modifying the level’s textures is REALLY REALLY cool, and the gore system sounds intense.

Sadly wave based games have never appealed to me all that much (original KF really didn’t do anything for me), so I might not get to enjoy the technically impressive game because of my personal preferences ):.

Read full topic

item.title: Killing Floor 2!
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Well, I’d know if the Classification Board wasn’t so inconsistent…

Gothic 2 rated “M” -> Risen “Refused Classification”

Risen was RC because of drugs (swampweed) that give XP (and mana?) and the brothel / prostitutes… both of which were present in Gothic 2.
Risen was never released through retail here and can’t be bought on Steam (yay GOG and GamersGate).

Gothic 2 also had sex “as a reward” for a quest, which was what got The Witcher 2 censored here.

Left 4 Dead 2 “Refused Classification” (later censored and “MA”) -> Dead Island “MA”

Left 4 Dead 2 was RC and later censored due to violence. Dead Island was just as violent (if not more), I think.

I wonder if Killing Floor 2 will retain accurate hipfire?

Read full topic
